intro: Macaglia camporum, commonly known as the Camporos campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as carnations and snapdragons. The plant features slender stems and small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Macaglia camporum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
